<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/c841afff6a89592f23710c6da5b0fea89b240937|patch 8.2.1289: crash when using a custom completion function>
patch 8.2.1289: crash when using a custom completion function

Problem:    Crash when using a custom completion function.
Solution:   Initialize all of the expand_T. (closes #6532)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1289: crash when using a custom completion function · vim/vim@c841aff
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1289: crash when using a custom completion function · vim/vim@c841aff
attachments.text: Problem: Crash when using a custom completion function. Solution: Initialize all of the expand_T. (closes #6532)

text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/925e9fd6339981c1015410e1b6a6dd19e34f36cc|patch 8.2.1290: Vim9: cannot replace a global function>
patch 8.2.1290: Vim9: cannot replace a global function

Problem:    Vim9: cannot replace a global function.
Solution:   Allow for "!" on a global function. (closes #6524)  Also fix that
            :delfunc on a :def function only made it empty.

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.1290: Vim9: cannot replace a global function · vim/vim@925e9fd
attachments.title: patch 8.2.1290: Vim9: cannot replace a global function · vim/vim@925e9fd
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: cannot replace a global function. Solution: Allow for "!" on a global function. (closes #6524) Also fix that :delfunc on a :def function only made it empty.

patch 8.2.1291: Vim9: type of varargs items is not checked

Problem:    Vim9: type of varargs items is not checked.
Solution:   Check the list item types. (closes #6523)

<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/13e12b8a3c0fec29017f2dbdc6f57e372f8a7efd|patch 8.2.1288: Vim9: cannot use mark in range>
patch 8.2.1288: Vim9: cannot use mark in range

Problem:    Vim9: cannot use mark in range.
Solution:   Use the flag that a colon was seen. (closes #6528)

attachments.title: patch 8.2.1288: Vim9: cannot use mark in range · vim/vim@13e12b8
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: cannot use mark in range. Solution: Use the flag that a colon was seen. (closes #6528)
